intro: Prestoea montana, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically large, heart-shaped, and have a smooth texture. Prestoea montana thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas and mountainous regions.
